If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/711](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/711) (refactor: Disable unused special members functions in `UnlockContext` by hebasto)
* [#26812](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26812) (test: add end-to-end tests for CConnman and PeerManager by vasild)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK
Is there a reason why these two are not enabled?

> Is there a reason why they these two are not enabled?

The required fixes seem too invasive for this PR.

Not sure. This makes the code pretty verbose and it is unclear whether append or strprintf should be used. Also, while this check is disabled for non-loops. In our code it is only triggered on errors in loops.

Updated 66b5bdd791aca024996db182cfdec4439895bec0 -> 0524c30fbb05686a8cf8949a4b05d4a3c9a4c118 ([pr26642.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr26642.01) -> [pr26642.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr26642.02)):

Maybe split this out to make review/testing easier. It may be related to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25429 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26308

> Maybe split this out to make review/testing easier. It may be related to #25429 and #26308

Done in #26758.

Should be green now :)

Rebased 38f8938868f8ebebf3353e137957358399704a4b -> 9e81656e92c91d128db8a5fcaecb0c385bb012cb ([pr26642.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr26642.05) -> [pr26642.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr26642.06)) on top of the merged #26905.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

> Mind reviewing changes in bench/nanobench.h?

ACK the nanobench.h changes. I'd like to keep the version in sync with the upstream repository at https://github.com/martinus/nanobench

So I'll have a look at the clang-tidy checks there, do a bunch of updates, and then create a PR to update the nanobench version here to stay in sync. That might take a while though.
I created #27030 which compiles without warnings with the `.clang-tidy` changes here

> I created #27030 which compiles without warnings with the `.clang-tidy` changes here

Converting this PR to a draft for now.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

> > I created #27030 which compiles without warnings with the `.clang-tidy` changes here
> 
> Converting this PR to a draft for now.

Rebased on the merged #27030, and is ready for a (final?) review :)

I'm not sure this is correct. `CopyFrom` is not noexcept, so marking this as noexcept can be dangerous. 
CopyFrom seems to use the copy assignment operator with its `*this = rhs;` which too is not noexcept. I think it can currently be marked as noexcept (based on the members here), but this is dangerous; e.g. when you add any data that needs allocating, the `noexcept` would be a lie and bad_alloc exceptions would cause the program to abort
Drafted. Please review https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/711 first.
